Class InMemoryCrudRepository<T,ID>

java.lang.Object
database.InMemoryCrudRepository<T,ID>
Type Parameters:
T - the entity type managed by this repository
ID - the type of the entity's unique identifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudRepository<T,ID>
public class InMemoryCrudRepository<T,ID> extends Object implements CrudRepository<T,ID>
Generic in-memory implementation of the CrudRepository interface.

This class provides a thread-safe, in-memory storage solution for entities using a ConcurrentHashMap. It serves as a base implementation for repositories that need simple CRUD operations without domain-specific query methods.

Key Features:

  • Thread-Safety: Uses ConcurrentHashMap for concurrent access
  • Generic Design: Works with any entity type and ID type
  • Flexible ID Extraction: Accepts a custom function to extract IDs from entities
  • Fast Access: O(1) lookups, inserts, and deletes

Design Considerations:

  • Entities must have stable IDs that don't change after creation
  • All data is stored in memory and lost when the application stops
  • Suitable for development, testing, and small-scale applications
  • For production systems with large datasets, consider persistent storage

Usage Example: 


 // Create a repository for Student entities with String IDs
 Function<Student, String> idExtractor = Student::getUserId;
 CrudRepository<Student, String> studentRepo = 
     new InMemoryCrudRepository<>(idExtractor);
 
 // Save a student
 Student student = new Student("U1234567A", "John Doe", "CS", 3, "john@example.com");
 studentRepo.save(student);
 
 // Find by ID
 Optional<Student> found = studentRepo.findById("U1234567A");

  • Field Details

    • store

      protected final Map<ID,T> store
      The internal concurrent map storing entities by their IDs.

      ConcurrentHashMap is used instead of HashMap to provide thread-safety without requiring external synchronization. This allows multiple threads to safely read and write to the repository concurrently.

  • Constructor Details

    • InMemoryCrudRepository

      public InMemoryCrudRepository(Function<T,ID> idExtractor)
      Constructs a new InMemoryCrudRepository with the specified ID extraction function.

      The ID extractor must return a non-null, stable ID for each entity.

      Parameters:
      idExtractor - function to extract the ID from an entity (must not be null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if idExtractor is null

  • Method Details

    • findById

      public Optional<T> findById(ID id)
      Retrieves an entity by its unique identifier.

      Returns an Optional containing the entity if found, or an empty Optional if no entity with the given ID exists.

      Performance: O(1) time complexity.

      Specified by:
      findById in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the entity to retrieve
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the entity if found, empty otherwise

    • findAll

      public List<T> findAll()
      Retrieves all entities in the repository.

      Returns an immutable or defensive copy of all entities to prevent external modification of the repository's internal state.

      Implementation Note: Returns an immutable copy of the values to prevent external modification of the repository's internal state.

      Performance: O(n) time complexity where n is the number of entities.

      Specified by:
      findAll in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Returns:
      a list containing all entities (never null, may be empty)

    • save

      public T save(T entity)
      Saves an entity to the repository (insert or update).

      Upsert Behavior:

      • If an entity with the same ID exists, it is replaced (update)
      • If no entity with the ID exists, it is added (insert)

      The entity's ID must not be null when saved.

      Workflow:

      1. Extracts the ID from the entity using the idExtractor function
      2. Validates that the ID is not null
      3. Stores the entity in the map (replacing any existing entity with the same ID)

      Performance: O(1) time complexity.

      Specified by:
      save in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity to save (must not be null, ID must not be null)
      Returns:
      the saved entity
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the extracted entity ID is null

    • saveAll

      public List<T> saveAll(Iterable<T> entities)
      Saves multiple entities to the repository.

      Convenience method for bulk operations. Each entity is saved using the same upsert logic as CrudRepository.save(Object).

      Performance: O(n) time complexity where n is the number of entities to save.

      Specified by:
      saveAll in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      entities - the entities to save (must not be null)
      Returns:
      a list of all saved entities in the order they were processed

    • deleteById

      public void deleteById(ID id)
      Deletes an entity by its unique identifier.

      If no entity with the given ID exists, this method has no effect (does not throw an exception).

      Performance: O(1) time complexity.

      If the ID doesn't exist, this method has no effect (no exception thrown).

      Specified by:
      deleteById in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the entity to delete

    • deleteAllById

      public void deleteAllById(Iterable<ID> ids)
      Deletes multiple entities by their identifiers.

      Convenience method for bulk deletion. For each ID, if an entity exists, it is removed; otherwise, that ID is silently ignored.

      Performance: O(n) time complexity where n is the number of IDs to delete.

      Specified by:
      deleteAllById in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      ids - the collection of identifiers for entities to delete

    • deleteAll

      public void deleteAll()
      Deletes all entities from the repository.

      Warning: This operation removes all data and cannot be undone. Use with caution, typically only for testing or reset operations.

      Warning: This clears all data from the repository. This operation cannot be undone.

      Performance: O(1) time complexity.

      Specified by:
      deleteAll in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>

    • existsById

      public boolean existsById(ID id)
      Checks whether an entity with the given identifier exists.

      Useful for validation before attempting to retrieve or modify an entity.

      Performance: O(1) time complexity.

      Specified by:
      existsById in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier to check
      Returns:
      true if an entity with this ID exists, false otherwise

    • count

      public long count()
      Returns the total number of entities in the repository.

      Useful for statistics, pagination calculations, or validation.

      Performance: O(1) time complexity.

      Specified by:
      count in interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
      Returns:
      the count of all entities (never negative)
